tuv.seg: Adoption is the process whereby a child becomes a member of a new family
Is é is uchtú ann ná próiseas trína n-éiríonn leanbh ina bhall de theaghlach nua
It creates a permanent, legal relationship between the adoptive parents and the child
Cruthaíonn sé gaolmhaireacht dhlíthiúil bhuan idir na tuismitheoirí uchtála agus an leanbh
Adopting a child who is resident in Ireland is called a domestic adoption
Tugtar uchtú intíre ar uchtú leanbh atá ina chónaí in Éirinn
If the child is living abroad, the process is called intercountry adoption
Más rud é go bhfuil an leanbh ina chónaí thar lear, tugtar uchtú idir thíortha ar an bpróiseas
An adoptive mother (or a man who is a sole adopter) is entitled to avail of adoptive leave from employment
Tá máthair uchtála (nó fear atá ina uchtaitheoir aonair) i dteideal leas a bhaint as saoire uchtaíoch ó fhostaíocht
As adoption is a complex legal process, it is helpful to be aware of the basics of adoption law
Ós rud é gur próiseas casta dlí é uchtú, tá sé ina chabhair eolas a bheith agat ar na gnéithe bunúsacha den dlí um uchtú
• Tusla - the Child and Family Agency is the competent authority for the processing of domestic adoptions
• Is é Tusla - an Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach an t-údarás inniúil maidir le huchtuithe intíre a phróiseáil
Accredited bodies work with Tusla in all areas of adoption, undertaking those activities for which they are accredited
Oibríonn comhlachtaí creidiúnaithe le Tusla i ngach réimse uchtaithe, ag tabhairt faoi na gníomhaíochtaí sin a bhfuil siad creidiúnaithe ina leith
• An adoption order secures in law the position of the child in the adoptive family
• Daingníonn ordú uchtaithe seasamh an linbh sa teaghlach uchtála sa dlí
The child is regarded in law as the child of the adoptive parents as if he/she were born to them
Breithnítear sa dlí go bhfuil an leanbh ar leanbh na dtuismitheoirí uchtála faoi is dá mbéarfaí é/í leo
Legal adoption is permanent
Is buan atá uchtú dlíthiúil
• Adoption orders are made by the Adoption Authority of Ireland
• Déanann Údarás Uchtála na hÉireann orduithe uchtaithe
It was established in November 2010 under the Adoption Act 2010
Bunaíodh é i mí na Samhna 2010 faoin Acht Uchtaithe 2010
• The law allows the adoption of orphans and children born outside marriage (including, in certain circumstances, children whose natural parents subsequently marry each other)
• Ceadaíonn an dlí an t-uchtú dílleachtaí agus leanaí a rugadh lasmuigh de phósadh (lena n-áirítear, i gcásanna áirithe, leanaí a bpósann a dtuismitheoirí nádúrtha a chéile ina dhiaidh sin)
In exceptional cases, the High Court can authorise the adoption of children whose parents have failed in their duty of care towards them (this can include children born within marriage)
I gcásanna eisceachtúla, féadann an Ard-Chúirt an t-uchtú leanaí ar theip ar a dtuismitheoirí ina ndualgas cúram ina dtaobh (is féidir leanaí a rugadh laistigh de phósadh a chur san áireamh anseo)
See the Tusla website
Féach láithreán Gréasáin Tusla
A step-parent adoption occurs when a child is adopted by a married couple, one of whom is the natural parent of the child (usually the mother) while the other is not

Tarlaíonn uchtú leastuismitheora nuair a uchtaíonn lánúin phósta leanbh, arb é duine amháin den lánúin tuismitheoir nádúrtha an linbh (an mháthair de ghnáth) agus nach é an duine eile tuismitheoir nádúrtha an linbh
Both the natural parent and the step-parent must adopt the child in order to avoid the natural parent losing his/her rights and responsibilities to the child
Ní mór don tuismitheoir nádúrtha agus don leastuismitheoir an leanbh a uchtú le nach gcailleann an tuismitheoir nádúrtha a chearta/cearta agus a fhreagrachtaí/freagrachtaí i leith an linbh
If a child was born within a previous marriage, where the natural parent has now remarried following a divorce or the death of his/her spouse, the child is not eligible for adoption
Más rud é gur rugadh leanbh laistigh de phósadh roimhe sin, sá chás gur athphós an tuismitheoir nádúrtha anois tar éis colscartha nó tar éis bhás a chéile/céile, níl an leanbh i dteideal uchtaithe
An extended family adoption occurs where a member of the child’s family or a relative adopts the child
Tarlaíonn uchtú mórtheaghlaigh nuair atá an leanbh á uchtú ag ball de theaghlach an linbh nó ag gaol
The child would have been placed with them by the birth mother or by the Tusla child care system
Chuirfí an mháthair bhreithe nó córas cúram leanaí Tusla an leanbh faoina chúram
Domestic infant adoption is where a child is placed with an alternative set of parents
Is é is uchtú intíre naín ann ná cás ina gcuirtear leanbh faoi chúram beirt tuismitheoirí eile
The child may only be placed with the couple by the Tusla adoption service or registered adoption society
Ní fhéadfaidh ach seirbhís uchtála Tusla nó cumann uchtála cláraithe an leanbh a chur faoi chúram na lánúine
The Adoption Authority must approve the placement before it takes place
Ní mór don Údarás Uchtála an socrúchán a fhormheas sula dtarlaíonn sé
Long term foster care adoption
Uchtú cúraim altrama fhadtéarmaigh
Foster care adoption occurs when a couple adopt a child who was originally placed with them in a foster care situation
Tarlaíonn uchtú cúraim altrama nuair a uchtaíonn lánúin leanbh a cuireadh faoina gcúram ar dtús i gcás cúraim altrama
There is more information on the different types of domestic adoption on the Adoption Authority’s website
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise faoi na cineálacha éagsúla d’uchtú intíre ar fáil ar láithreán Gréasáin an Údaráis Uchtála
In order to adopt a child, you must be at least 21 years of age and resident in the State
D’fhonn leanbh a uchtú, ní mór duit bheith 21 bliain d’aois ar a laghad agus i do chónaí sa Stát
Where the child is being adopted by a married couple and one of them is the mother or father or a relative of the child, only one of them must have attained the age of 21 years
Sa chás go bhfuil an leanbh á uchtú ag lánúin phósta agus gurb é duine amháin acu máthair nó athair nó gaol an linbh, tá sé riachtanach go bhfuil duine amháin acu 21 bliain d’aois ar a laghad
The following persons are eligible to adopt:
Tá na daoine seo a leanas i dteideal uchtú:
• A married couple living together
• Lánúin phósta atá ina gcónaí le chéile
• A married person alone
• Duine pósta ina aonar

The other spouse's consent to adopt must be obtained unless the couple is living apart and separated under a court decree or a deed of separation, the other spouse has deserted the prospective adoptive parent or the other spouse's conduct has resulted in the prospective adoptive parent leaving them, with just cause

Ní mór toiliú an chéile eile le huchtú a fháil mura bhfuil an lánúin ina gcónaí ar leithligh óna chéile agus idirscartha faoi fhoraithne chúirte nó faoi ghníomhas idirscartha, más rud é gur thréig an céile eile an tuismitheoir uchtála ionchasach nó go raibh iompraíocht an chéile eile ina cúis leis an tuismitheoir uchtála ionchasach ag fágáil an chéile eile, agus cúis chóir aige/aici

• The mother, father or relative of the child (relative meaning a grandparent, brother, sister, uncle or aunt of the child and/or the spouse of any such person, the relationship to the child being traced through the mother or the father)

• Máthair, athair nó gaol an linbh (ciallaíonn gaol seantuismitheoir, deartháir, deirfiúr, uncail nó aintín an linbh agus/nó céile aon duine den chineál sin, agus an ghaolmhaireacht leis an leanbh á rianú tríd an máthair nó tríd an athair)
• A widow or widower
• Baintreach nó baintreach fir
• A sole applicant who is not in one of the categories listed above may only adopt where the Adoption Authority is satisfied that, in the particular circumstances of the case, it is desirable

• Ní fhéadfaidh iarratasóir aonair nach bhfuil i gceann amháin de na catagóirí atá liostaithe thuas uchtú a dhéanamh ach sa chás gur deimhin leis an Údarás Uchtála, in imthosca ar leith an cháis, go bhfuil sé inmhianaithe
It is not possible for two unmarried persons to adopt jointly
Ní féidir le beirt daoine neamhphósta uchtú i gcomhpháirt
The Children and Family Relationships Act 2015 provides that civil partners and cohabiting couples may jointly adopt a child
Soláthraíonn an tAcht Leanaí agus Caidrimh Teaghlaigh 2015 gur féidir páirtnéirí sibhialta agus lánúineacha ag maireachtáil i bhfochair a uchtú i gcomhpháirt le leanbh
The relevant sections of the Act have not yet come into effect
Na hailt ábhartha den Acht nach bhfuil tagtha go fóill i bhfeidhm
There are no legal upper age limits for adopting parents
Níl aon uasteorainneacha aoise i bhfeidhm maidir le tuismitheoirí atá ag uchtú
Tusla has more information on who can adopt
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi cé a fhéadann uchtú ag Tusla
The consent of the parents/guardians of the child to the adoption is a legal requirement
Ceanglas dlíthiúil is ea toiliú thuismitheoirí/chaomhnóirí an linbh leis an uchtú
If the child is born outside marriage and the father has no guardianship rights, only the mother's consent is needed, but the father is entitled to be consulted (if possible)

Más rud é go mbeirtear an leanbh lasmuigh de phósadh agus nach bhfuil aon chearta caomhnóireachta ag an athair, níl ach toiliú na máthar ag teastáil, ach tá an t-athair i dteideal go dtéitear i gcomhairle leis (más féidir)
However, the consent of the father is required if he marries the mother after the birth of the child or he is appointed guardian or is granted custody of the child by court order
Tá toiliú an athar ag teastáil, áfach, más rud é go bpósann sé an mháthair tar éis bhreith an linbh nó go gceaptar é mar chaomhnóir nó go ndeonaítear caomhnóireacht an linbh dó trí ordú cúirte
The mother, father (where he is guardian) or other legal guardian must give an initial consent or agreement to the placing of a child for adoption by Tusla or an approved adoption service

Ní mór don mháthair, don athair (nuair is caomhnóir é) nó d’aon chaomhnóir dlíthiúil eile toiliú tosaigh nó comhaontú a thabhairt leis an leanbh a thabhairt lena uchtú ag Tusla nó ag seirbhís uchtála fhormheasta
They must then give their consent to the making of an adoption order
Ní mór dóibh ansin a dtoiliú a thabhairt le hordú uchtaithe a dhéanamh
This consent may be withdrawn any time before the making of the adoption order
Féadfar an toiliú sin a tharraingt siar am ar bith sula ndéantar an t-ordú uchtaithe
If the mother either refuses consent or withdraws consent already given, the adopting parents may apply to the High Court for an order
Más rud é go ndiúltaíonn an mháthair toiliú nó go dtarraingíonn sí siar toiliú a tugadh cheana, féadfaidh na tuismitheoirí atá ag uchtú iarratas a dhéanamh ar ordú chuig an Ard-Chúirt

If the court is satisfied that it is in the best interests of the child, it will make an order giving custody of the child to the adopting parents for a specified period and authorising the Adoption Authority to dispense with the mother's consent to the making of the adoption order

Más deimhin leis an gcúirt go bhfuil sé le leas is fearr an linbh, déanfaidh sí ordú lena dtugtar cúram an linbh do na tuismitheoirí atá ag uchtú ar feadh tréimhse shonraithe agus lena dtugtar údarás don Údarás Uchtála toiliú na máthar le déanamh an ordaithe uchtaithe a ligean thar ceal

If a mother changes her mind about adoption before the making of the adoption order, but the adopting parents refuse to give up the child, she may then institute legal proceedings to have custody of her child returned to her

Más rud é go n-athraíonn máthair a hintinn faoi uchtú sula ndéantar an t-ordú uchtaithe, ach diúltaíonn na tuismitheoirí atá ag uchtú an leanbh a thabhairt uathu, féadfaidh sí imeachtaí dlí a thionscnamh ansin le go dtabharfar cúram an linbh ar ais di
A birth father, with no guardianship rights, is entitled to be consulted about the adoption of his child
Tá athair breithe, nach bhfuil aon chearta caomhnóireachta aige, i dteideal go dtéitear i gcomhairle leis faoi uchtú a linbh

If you are concerned that your partner or former partner intends placing your child for adoption without letting you know, you can ask the Adoption Authority to notify you by recording your details on the Birth Father Register

Más rud é go bhfuil tú buartha go bhfuil sé beartaithe ag do pháirtnéir nó ag d’iarpháirtnéir do leanbh a chur lena uchtú gan eolas a thabhairt duit, féadfaidh tú iarraidh ar an Údarás Uchtála fógra a thabhairt duit ach do shonraí a thaifeadadh ar Chlár na nAithreacha Breithe
You can do this even before your child is born, if necessary
Is féidir leat déanamh amhlaidh sula mbeirtear do leanbh, más gá
This register is checked against all applications for adoption
Seiceáiltear an clár sin in aghaidh gach iarratais ar uchtú
Applicants being considered for adoption undergo a detailed assessment
Rachaidh iarratasóirí atá á mbreithniú le haghaidh uchtú faoi mheasúnú mionsonraithe
The assessment is carried out by an adoption society or Tusla social worker
Déanann cumann uchtála nó oibrí sóisialta de chuid Tusla an measúnú
It includes a number of interviews and home visits
Áirítear leis roinnt agallamh agus cuairteanna baile
Where the application is in respect of a married couple, there are both individual and joint interviews
Sa chás go mbaineann an t-iarratas le lánúin phósta, cuirfear agallaimh aonair agus comhagallaimh araon ar siúl

The social worker will discusses such areas as previous and/or current relationships, motives for adopting, expectations of the child and the ability to help a child to develop his/her knowledge and understanding of his/her natural background

Pléifidh an t-oibrí sóisialta réimsí amhail caidrimh roimhe sin agus/nó caidrimh reatha, cúiseanna le huchtú, ionchais an linbh agus an cumas chun cabhrú leis an leanbh forbairt a dhéanamh ar a eolas/heolas agus ar an tuiscint atá aige/aici ar a chúlra/cúlra nádúrtha
All applicants are required to undergo a medical examination
Tá ceangal ar gach iarratasóir dul faoi scrúdú dochtúra
The social worker then prepares a report which goes before the local adoption committee and a recommendation is made
Ullmhaíonn an t-oibrí sóisialta tuarascáil ansin a chuirtear faoi bhráid an choiste uchtála áitiúil agus déantar moladh
Declaration of eligibility and suitability
Dearbhú incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta
Your application for assessment, the report and the local adoption committee’s recommendations are sent to the Adoption Authority
Cuirtear d’iarratas ar mheasúnú, an tuarascáil agus moltaí an choiste uchtála áitiúil chuig an Údarás Uchtála
If all documents are in place and correct, and the recommendations are positive, the Adoption Authority grants a declaration of eligibility and suitability
Más i bhfeidhm agus ceart atá na cáipéisí uile, agus más dearfach atá na moltaí, deonóidh an tÚdarás Uchtála dearbhú incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta
The declaration is granted for a period of 2 years from the date it is issued
Deonaítear an dearbhú ar feadh tréimhse 2 bhliain ón dáta ar a n-eisítear é
It may include in it a statement relating to the age or state of health of a child whom you are considered suited to parent – this is based on information provided in the assessment report

Is féidir go gcuirfear san áireamh ann ráiteas a bhaineann le haois nó le riocht sláinte an linbh a meastar thú a bheith i do thuismitheoir oiriúnach aige/aici - tá sé sin bunaithe ar an bhfaisnéis a chuirtear ar fáil sa tuarascáil mheasúnaithe

The period of time between the granting of the declaration of eligibility and suitability to the making of an adoption order differs from one case to another depending on the type of adoption application being made and the particular circumstances of the applicants and the child

Is éagsúil ó chás go cás atá an tréimhse ama idir deonú an dearbhaithe incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta agus déanamh an ordaithe uchtaithe. Braitheann sí ar chineál an iarratais uchtaithe atá á dhéanamh agus ar thosca ar leith na n-iarratasóirí agus an linbh

In the case of a step-parent adoption where the child is in situ, it is expected that the application for the adoption order will progress during the lifespan of the declaration of eligibility and suitability

I gcás uchtú leastuismitheora mar a bhfuil an leanbh in situ, táthar ag súil go ndéanfar dul chun cinn ar an iarratas ar an ordú uchtaithe le linn thréimhse feidhme an dearbhaithe incháilitheachta agus oiriúnachta
Where it is a domestic infant adoption, there is no guarantee that a couple will be matched with a child during the lifetime of the declaration
Sá chás gur uchtú intíre naín é, níl aon ráthaíocht go meaitseálfar lánúin le leanbh le linn thréimhse feidhme an dearbhaithe
Before making an adoption order the Adoption Authority must be satisfied that the child is eligible to be adopted
Sula ndéanann tú ordú uchtaithe, ní mór gur deimhin leis an Údarás Uchtála go bhfuil an leanbh i dteideal uchtaithe
You can find information on the issues that may arise after the declaration is issued on the Authority’s website
Ar láithreán Gréasáin an Údaráis, is féidir leat teacht ar fhaisnéis faoi na saincheisteanna a d’fhéadfadh teacht chun cinn tar éis an dearbhú a eisiúint
When the adoption order is finally being made, you go before the Board of the Adoption Authority with the child and give sworn evidence as to your identity and eligibility
Nuair atá an t-ordú uchtaithe á dhéanamh sa deireadh, téann tú os comhair Bhord an Údaráis Uchtála leis an leanbh agus tugann tú fianaise faoi mhionn maidir le d’aitheantas agus le d’incháilitheacht
You will have previously completed a form indicating the name that you want on the adoption order for the child
Beidh foirm comhlánaithe agat roimhe sin lena gcuirtear in iúl an t-ainm ba mhaith leat a bheith ar an ordú uchtaithe i gcomhair an linbh
This can be changed at the adoption hearing but it is preferable for this to have been agreed on before the date of the hearing
Is féidir é sin a athrú ag an éisteacht uchtaithe ach is fearr é a chomhaontú ar dháta na héisteachta nó roimhe sin
Find out more about the adoption hearing here
Faigh tuilleadh faisnéise faoin éisteacht uchtaithe anseo
At the adoption hearing, you are given information on how to go about getting a new birth certificate for the child
Ag an éisteacht uchtaithe, tabharfar faisnéis duit faoi conas a dhéanfaidh tú teastas breithe nua a fháil don leanbh
The new birth certificate (adoption certificate) is normally be available through the Registrar General's Office within 4 weeks
De ghnáth, beidh an teastas breithe nua (an teastas uchtaithe) ar fáil trí Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora laistigh de 4 seachtaine
Although it is not an actual birth certificate, it has the status of one for legal purposes
Cé nach teastas breithe iarbhír é, is ionann a stádas chun críocha dlí
It gives the date of the adoption order and the names and addresses of the adoptive parents and is similar in all aspects to a birth certificate
Tugann sé dáta an ordaithe uchtaithe agus ainmneacha agus seoltaí na dtuismitheoirí uchtála agus tá sé cosúil le teastas breithe i ngach gné
If you have an enquiry about adoption in Ireland, contact one of the approved adoption societies or your local Tusla adoption service
Más rud é go bhfuil fiosrú agat maidir le huchtú in Éirinn, déan teagmháil le ceann amháin de na cumainn uchtála fhormheasta nó den tseirbhís uchtála is cóngaraí duit de chuid Tusla
A certified copy of an entry in the Adopted Children Register, which can be used for legal and administrative purposes, costs €10
Tá costas €10 ar chóip dheimhnithe d’iontráil i gClár na Leanaí Uchtaithe, rud is féidir a úsáid chun críocha dlí agus riaracháin
It is available through the Registrar General's Office
Tá sí ar fáil trí Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora
You can download an application form or apply online here
Is féidir leat foirm iarratais a íoslódáil nó iarratas a dhéanamh ar líne anseo
